operation.descriptionCdata:
1cbc473d-632c-44cf-9980-7fa8dbf7cbf6.description=
Scans for a specified HTML flag and returns everything between that flag and its closing flag. For example\:
if flag is table then then everything between  and 
 is returned. The function does support nested tables, specifically if the html had\:

foo


bar




moo


The inner table (bar) will NOT be gotten. But foo or moo can be, and if foo is gotten it will contain the sub-table bar.

inputs\:
occurrenceNumber - which flagged section to return, 1 \= first section, 2 \= second. 0 will return the entire document.
startFlag - the html flag to parse on, in the above example this was 
html - the html to parse. NOTE, this is the actual html, not the path to an html file.

returns - The information between  and 

Extra Results\:
htmlParamNames - The names of all parameters in the  header.
htmlParamValues - The names of all values that correspond to htmlParamNames.

Responses\:
success - the specified flag was returned.
failure - The parse failed, the html does not have enough occurrences of flag.
operation.name: HTML Parser (1)

scriptlet.name: Operation HTML Parser (1) (60340cc7-38b4-400b-b90a-17b39ad9d36d)
